ratings.comment: Very Easy class! You get open notes and easy quizzes. She also covers a lot of topics that are interesting! Easy A

The person below is just upset because they're one of the people that talked during class and got called out.  All you have to do is sit and listen and you have a guaranteed A.  You don't even have to do the readings, the exams are take home and easy to do in one night.  If you can BS a paper and sit quietly in class this is the best ethnic course
Very easy. Open book tests and one is dropped. Just do as she says and you'll be fine.

Extremely easy. Only a few EASY writing assignments. Many reading assignments for each lecture. If you take the lecture that's only 1 day a week-good luck, it's extremely boring and you can't have laptops. The topics are interesting. I'd recommend it for an ethnic studies course. 4 "exams" that are open note and open readings!

This class was worthless.  I've never disliked a professor as much as I dislike her- she's boring and talks in monotone. She interrupts good documentaries with her pointless babbling.  She's incredibly unhelpful.  I would NEVER recommend taking her if you value your sanity.  There are a few choice words I wish i could use to describe her

This is the easiest class ever, and the Professor is really nice. Small written assignments, attend a diversity dialogue, 3 quizzes (open book and open note), and read a reasonable amount each week. NO EXAMS! The info is usually interesting, and as long as you go you'd have to be an idiot not to get a B at least. So easy!!

I loved this class! She clearly cares about the subject, and spends more of her energy on the class learning than on testing (no exams, one short paper, one paper of moderate length) because she wants students to learn to care.

This was the most boring class I have taken in my college career. She stood in front of the class talking quietly and in monotone for 2.5 hours!! She's a hard grader. Not too many assignments but she takes attendance at the end of class and usually keeps us late because she starts a discussion with 3 minutes left of class
